name: Name The Movie Quiz | Name the Movie | 10 Questions

questions.text: This 1998 computer animation film featured the voices of Kevin Spacey and Julia Louis-Dreyfus.
questions.explanation:
A Bug's Life.

	Brought to you by the same director (John Lassiter) of "Toy Story", this wonderful movie retells the Aesop fable "The Ant and The Grasshopper".  Among the many talented voices in this movie are Kevin Spacey (Hopper), Julia Louis-Dreyfus (Princess Atta), David Hyde Pierce (Slim) and Madeline Kahn (Gypsy).  My personal favorite character is Heimlich (voiced by Joe Ranft).

questions.text: This 1986 movie had the tagline "Knowing what you know now, what would you do differently?"
questions.explanation:
Peggy Sue Got Married.

	Starring Kathleen Turner and Nicholas Cage. This movie was about a middle aged woman (Turner) who is having problems with her husband (Cage). She gets warped back to 1960, where she is a teenager again.  Jim Carrey had a small part in the movie.

questions.text: This movie paired Spencer Tracy and Katharine Hepburn as husband and wife attorneys.
questions.explanation:
Adam's Rib.

	This 1949 comedy saw the fourth pairing of screen duo Tracy and Hepburn.  In this movie, they portray attorneys on opposite sides of an attempted murder case.

questions.text: This musical featured songs such as "June Is Busting Out All Over" and "If I Loved You".
questions.explanation:
Carousel.

	This 1956 movie was adapted from the 1945 Rodgers and Hammerstein Broadway play.  Starring Shirley Jones as Julie Jordan, who falls in love with carousel barker Billy Bigelow (Gordon MacRae). This movie was the second pairing of Jones and MacRae.  They both starred in the successful 1955 musical "Oklahoma".

questions.text: In this movie you would find the characters Chief Brody, Quint and Hooper.
questions.explanation:
Jaws.

	The bestselling novel by Peter Benchley, "Jaws" was adapted to the big screen in 1975. Starring Roy Scheider (Brody), Robert Shaw (Quint) and Richard Dreyfuss(Hooper). The real star of the movie was "Bruce" the mechanical shark.

questions.text: This 1980 movie starred Gene Wilder and Richard Pryor, who get framed for a crime they didn't commit.
options: See No Evil, Hear No Evil
questions.explanation:
Stir Crazy.

	Directed by Sidney Poiter, this comedy reunited Wilder and Pryor after their successful teaming in the 1976 movie "Silver Streak".

questions.text: This 1973 tearjerker starred Robert DeNiro as a professional baseball player who is dying.
questions.explanation:
Bang the Drum Slowly.

	This movie, based on the novel by Mark Harris, starred DeNiro as baseball catcher Bruce Pearson.  Michael Moriarity co-starred as his team mate Henry Wiggen, who is there for Pearson as he dies of Hodgkin's Disease

questions.text: In this 1968 movie you'll hear "Kill the brain, you kill the ghoul".
questions.explanation:
Night of the Living Dead.

	This classic B horror film, directed by George Romero, featured zombies nibbling on limbs. Starring Duane Jones and Judith O'Dea.   It was originally released in 1968 but was taken out of theaters due to the extreme gore in the film.  It did, however, return back to theaters in 1969.  By 1979, it had grossed over 12 million dollars and became a cult classic.

questions.text: This crazy 1964 comedy featured many big name stars, including Dean Martin, Robert Mitchum and Paul Newman. The female star was Shirley MacLaine.
options: It's a Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad World
questions.explanation:
What a Way to Go!.

	Shirley MacLaine stars as Louisa, a widow worth 200 million dollars. She's convinced her money is cursed, since it seems everyone she marries becomes rich then dies.

questions.text: In this 1948 movie, Jane Wyman won an Academy Award for Best Actress portraying a deaf-mute.
questions.explanation:
Johnny Belinda.

	Adapted from the stage play by Elmer Harris, this movie tells the story of a deaf-mute girl (Wyman) living on a farm in Nova Scotia.
